abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Transport
            Infrastructure Investment Project for Madagascar is to
            rehabilitate the country's major transport
            infrastructure in order to reduce transport cost and to
            facilitate trade. The changes include: (i) extend the
            closing date to allow completion of activities that got
            delayed due to the political crisis; and (ii) reallocate the
            projects' proceeds to use up the credits'
            remaining funds (US$852,361.28) to finance some additional
            activities. The borrower has also requested to include a
            disbursement grace period to enable the payment of eligible
            expenditures up to four months after the project's
            closing date. However, due to the very limited amount of
            undisbursed funds, the Bank will only consider the project
            fund's reallocation proceed and deal with the
            disbursement grace period in a separate letter to the Borrower.
